Questions.Question1: If I had [this] %VARIABLE% on my iPad, I think that I would like to play it a lot.

Questions.Question2: I was confused many times when I was playing [this] %VARIABLE%.

Questions.Question3: I thought [this] %VARIABLE% was easy to use.

Questions.Question4: I would need help from an adult to continue to play [this] %VARIABLE%.

Questions.Question5: I always felt like I knew what to do next when I played [this] %VARIABLE%.

Questions.Question6: Some of the things I had to do when playing [this] %VARIABLE% did not make sense.

Questions.Question7: I think most of my friends could learn to play [this] %VARIABLE% very quickly.

Questions.Question8: Some of the things I had to do to play [this] %VARIABLE% were kind of weird.

Questions.Question9: I was confident when I was playing [this] %VARIABLE%.

Questions.Question10: I had to learn a lot of things before playing [this] %VARIABLE% well.

VariantGeneratorDescription: This english variant of the SUS questionnaire by Putman et al. is aimed at children between the ages of 9 and 11 and focused on the usability evaluation of learning apps. As preliminary validity evaluations with a small sample size failed to show full construct validity, the psychometric properties still have to be investigated further.
